meanings.sent1: The old bridge looked unsicker after the storm.
meanings.sent2: She felt unsicker walking alone in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The unsicker lock on the door kept opening by itself.
meanings.sent4: His unsicker grip on the slippery rope led to a fall.
meanings.sent5: The unsicker ladder wobbled dangerously as he climbed.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel uneasy or anxious
meanings.sent1: The horror movie unsickered her for days.
meanings.sent2: His sudden disappearance unsickered his friends.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected noise unsickered the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the room unsickered everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The ghost story unsickered the young campers around the fire.

meanings.sent1: The unclear instructions unsickered the students during the test.
meanings.sent2: She unsickered her decision after hearing conflicting advice.
meanings.sent3: The changing weather forecast unsickered the picnic planners.
meanings.sent4: His vague answers unsickered the interviewer.
meanings.sent5: The unsicker outcome of the experiment left the scientists puzzled.
